a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:36:"IELTS Listening Test - Key Facts";s:7:"content";s:945:"Understanding the IELTS Listening Test Format The IELTS Listening test is a standardized assessment that evaluates your ability to understand spoken English in various contexts. Here are the essential facts about the test: Test Structure: The Listening test consists of four sections, each with a different type of recording. Section 1 typically features a conversation between two people in a social context. Section 2 is usually a monologue in a social context. Section 3 involves a conversation between multiple people in an educational or training context. Section 4 is a monologue on an academic subject. Questions: The test always contains exactly 40 questions in total, with 10 questions allocated to each of the four sections. Timing: After the four sections are completed, you are given 10 minutes to transfer your answers from the question booklet to the answer sheet. This transfer time is crucial for ensuring your answers are recorded correctly. Recordings: Each recording is played only once. You do not get to hear them twice, so careful listening and note-taking are essential skills.";}}
